question:
A friend of yours is thinking about applying for the same course that you did 
at university. HelShe has asked for your advice about studying this subject. 
Write a letter to your friend. In your letter 
• give details of the course you took at the university 
• explain Why you recommend the university 
• give some advice about how to apply
text: I hope you're doing well, and as I understood, you're applying for the same course that I studied at Concordia University in the field of computer science. Let me give you some tips regarding the diploma.

The course is a 31-credit course which provides you with  a great background in computer science and professional programming skills. Although it seems intensive to have such a variety of subjects, that would be a fabulous asset to your CV. Moreover, Concordia University has a very good reputation among other universities in Montreal and graduating from the school of engineering will have a great impact on your both resume and career. So, I recommend you this course if you'd like to be successful in your future job.

In addition, keep in mind that you need to prepare a letter of explanation to convince the committee to accept your application as well as have a GPA within the required range. I can review your LOE and give you some suggestions before you submit your application.
I hope you find this helpful.
